data.title: The Lawrence School Sanawar
data.meta_description: The Lawrence School Sanawar slogan is "Never give In" and it instills in its students the confidence and bravery to overcome any obstacles
data.text:
The Lawrence School Sanawar was founded in 1847 and is one of the most prestigious and oldest schools in Asia. It is located in the Kasauli Hills of Himachal Pradesh in the district of Solan. Sanawar is about an hour’s drive from Chandigarh. The institution is one of the Asian subcontinent’s oldest surviving residential schools. The school is surrounded by forests of pine, deodar, and other coniferous trees, which cover an area of 139 acres at a height of 1750 meters. The school was founded by Sir Henry Lawrence and his wife Honoria.

The school’s slogan is “Never give In” and it instills in its students the confidence and bravery to overcome any obstacles. Sanawar made history in May 2013 when it became the first school in the world to send a team of seven pupils to climb Mount Everest.

About

The Lawrence School Sanawar

The Lawrence School Sanawar is one of India’s oldest coed residential schools. The school is affiliated to the Central Board of Secondary Education(CBSE). Its pupils come from a variety of backgrounds. The school’s goal is to grow children into individuals who are refined, disciplined. The school provides an environment that promotes the wellness of the kids who live and learn there.

If you want more info about the school, we’d love to tell you.

The campus of The Lawrence School Sanawar

The school is surrounded by forests of pine, deodar, and other coniferous trees, which cover an area of 139 acres at a height of 1750 meters. One of the new structures is the central dining hall. It serves over 3,000 meals every day. A solar-heated swimming pool and squash courts are available at this indoor sports complex. Parker Hall, now the school’s learning resource center, allows convenient access to archive artifacts, as well as a variety of other resources. The name of the main teaching block is ‘Birdwood’. There are various playing grounds in campus loaded with high-quality sports equipment for students. Students can participate in a variety of games and sports such as cricket, hockey, soccer, basketball, squash, tennis, badminton, table tennis, athletics, swimming, gymnastics, rifle shooting, and boxing.

Academics of The Lawrence School Sanawar

The Lawrence School educates students from grades V to XII. Each class has four divisions from class VII onwards. Each division has 25 to 28 children in it. The school follows the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE). In order to achieve the goal to educate children in an extraordinary way, the school has established the following academic goals:

Obtain outstanding results in the CBSE Class XII Board.

Provide students with the widest range of academic options possible, in accordance with global changes and advances.

Help student with academic, cultural, social, moral, and psychological counselling.

Provide a varied set of learning resources and infrastructure, including hardware, software, laboratories, and other materials.

Provide students with a progressive teacher support system in order to ensure that they receive a high-quality education.

Provide students with creative and participatory teaching methods and a well-trained team.

Awards and Achievements of The Lawrence School

The school has been named one of India’s best residential schools by many popular agencies. In 2003, The Tribune described this school as one of about half a dozen elite public schools in India, catering for “an upwardly mobile landed and commercial elite”. The school is an international member of the Headmasters’ and Headmistresses’ Conference, which is situated in England.

The Lawrence School Sanawar is a member of the Round Square Conference, a worldwide association of some eighty schools that exchange students with each other. Other member schools include the Doon School, Mayo College, Dhirubhai Ambani International School, Aiglon College in Switzerland, Ballarat Grammar School in Australia, Deerfield Academy and Chadwick School in the United States, Wellington in England, and Gordonstoun in Scotland.

General Facilities At The Lawrence School

The ‘Birdwood,’ which also houses Barne Hall, is the major teaching block. Plays, shows, films, lectures, and other cultural events are also held here on a regular basis.

Central dining hall

Indoor sports complex

Solar heated swimming pool

Squash courts

Parker Hall – learning resource centre

Computer with internet facilities

Sports Facilities At The Lawrence School Sanawar

Students can participate in a number of games and sports on campus, including cricket, hockey, soccer, basketball, squash, tennis, badminton, table tennis, athletics, swimming, gymnastics, rifle shooting, and boxing, which are all backed by quality equipment.

The Lawrence School Admission

Admission to The Lawrence school Sanawar is open to all boys and girls aged between 9 and 16 irrespective of social status, religion, or nationality. The School, which is nestled in nature’s green embrace, has been eponymous with the Sanawar hill on which it rests. One can’t help but be impressed by the beautiful greenery of the 139-acre site as one drives down the tiny curving road. Its big stone buildings, equipped with large Georgian windows, wide stone stairs, two cannons, and a ‘buggy,’ harken back to the colonial era. There are some certain eligibility criteria fixed for admission. Let’s take a look at that.

The Lawrence School Sanawar Admission Eligibility

The Lawrence School Admission Process

The Lawrence School Admission Application Form

The registration forms can be collected from the school office.

It can also be downloaded from the School’s website(www.sanawar.edu.in).

Completed registration forms should be sent by post or faxed to the School.

The child will however, only be registered on receipt of the appropriate fee remitted by Demand Draft or in online mode.

Online transfer made payable to The Headmaster, The Lawrence School, Sanawar at the State Bank of India, Sanawar ( Branch Code : 50199; IFSC Code:SBIN0050199).

You can also pay fees through UPI.

A photocopy of the child’s birth certificate will also be required by the School.

At the time of admission, a Transfer Certificate from the preceding school (if applicable) is required.

The Lawrence School Fees

The Lawrence School Entrance Exam Syllabus and Exam Pattern

The admission test comprises of the following subjects:

English (a written test of 100 marks: time duration one hour)

Mathematics (a written test of 100 marks: time duration one hour)

Science (a written test of 100 marks: time duration one hour)

Hindi (a written test of 100 marks: time duration one hour)

Note: Students who have not studied Hindi for more than 3 years are exempted from this test at the direction of the Headmaster, on request. A certified copy of subjects studied from the previous school is mandatory for seeking any exemption from Hindi.

To be eligible for the personal interaction, a candidate must pass all subjects with a score of 40 percent. Based on the personal interaction, a student is given a score out of 100. Communication skills, engagement in sports and other extracurricular activities, and reading habits are all highly valued at the school. During their personal engagement, students who excel in one or more of these areas are given special attention.

The Lawrence School Entrance Exam Date

Entrance test for 5th, 6th and 7th classe is usually conducted on the second Sunday of November.

Applications for classes 8th, 9th and 11th are received in December and children called for an Entrance test/ Personal interaction on the second Sunday of February (for class XI in April after the Class X Board Examination) only if there are vacancies.
